intro: Tarenna forsteniana, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit production in warm climates. Tarenna forsteniana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
